title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: interest fostering open welcoming environment, contributors maintainers pledge making participation project community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes creating positive environment include: Using welcoming inclusive language respectful differing viewpoints experiences Gracefully accepting constructive criticism Focusing best community Showing empathy towards community members Examples unacceptable behavior participants include: use sexualized language imagery unwelcome sexual attention advances Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical electronic address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Project maintainers responsible clarifying standards acceptable behavior expected take appropriate fair corrective action response instances unacceptable behavior. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, ban temporarily permanently contributor behaviors deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within project spaces public spaces individual representing project community. Examples representing project community include using official project e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event. Representation project may defined clarified project maintainers.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported contacting project team richel@richelbilderbeek.nl. complaints reviewed investigated result response deemed necessary appropriate circumstances. project team obligated maintain confidentiality regard reporter incident. details specific enforcement policies may posted separately. Project maintainers follow enforce Code Conduct good faith may face temporary permanent repercussions determined members project’s leadership.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 1.4, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/1/4/code--conduct.html answers common questions code conduct, see https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq

title: Contributing
text: Awesome reading . GitHub follows Contributor Covenant Code Conduct. questions, can create Issue Code changes go via Pull Requests

title: Contributing
text: maurcer part babette package suite, consists five packages. determine package best suited contribution: want contribute creation BEAST2 XML input file, go beautier. want contribute BEAST2 run, go beautier. want contribute BEAST2 output parsed, go tracerer want contribute packages work together, go babette want contribute regarding BEAST2 package management, right spot :-)

title: Contributing
text: Submitted code follow quality guidelines: tests pass cleanly/silently Code coverage must 100% Coding style follow default style lintr checked Travis CI submitting Pull Request. Emails code accepted.

title: Contributing
text: Awesome. options: Add Issue, test fails Submit Pull Request, test added tests/testthat folder Send @richelbilderbeek email (@richelbilderbeek make Issue ) Pull Requests follow guidelines ‘Submitting code’.

title: Contributing
text: master branch always build successfully development branch developers

title: Contributing
text: get started working babette : Development done develop branch. download checkout develop branch, first go beautier folder (cd babette), : workflow common git workflow:
code: git clone https://github.com/ropensci/babette git checkout develop git pull git add --all :/ git commit -m "Did something awesome" git push

title: mauricer demo
text: mauricer R package handle BEAST2 package management R, similar BEAST2 package manager. BEAST2 package manager vignette, : List BEAST2 packages Install first non-installed BEAST2 package Verify BEAST2 package indeed installed Uninstall BEAST2 package , ’ll need load mauricer. ’ll also load testthat testing: install BEAST2 packages, one needs internet connection BEAST2 must installed internet connection, BEAST2 installed, vignette close empty.
code: library(mauricer) library(testthat) if (!curl::has_internet()) {   print("No internet connection") } if (!beastier::is_beast2_installed()) {   print("No BEAST2 installed") } #> [1] "No BEAST2 installed"

title: mauricer demo
text: Use get_beast2_pkg_names get data frame name, version install status BEAST2 packages:

what: Install the first non-installed BEAST2 package
title: mauricer demo
text: Find package installed: Install package: Note installation uses non-CRAN package, called mauricerinstall, installing software CRAN policy.
code: if (curl::has_internet() && beastier::is_beast2_installed()) {   package_name <- beast2_packages[     beast2_packages$installed_version == "NA",   ]$name[1]   print(package_name) } if (curl::has_internet() && beastier::is_beast2_installed()) {   mauricerinstall::install_beast2_pkg(package_name) }

title: mauricer demo
text: Use uninstall_beast2_pkg: Also code uses non-CRAN package, called mauricerinstall, installing software CRAN policy.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Richèl J.C. Bilderbeek. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bilderbeek RJ, Etienne RS (2018). “babette: BEAUti 2, BEAST 2 Tracer R.” Methods Ecology Evolution. https://doi.org/10.1111/2041-210X.13032.
code: @Article{,   author = {Richèl JC Bilderbeek and Rampal S Etienne},   title = {babette: BEAUti 2, BEAST 2 and Tracer for R},   journal = {Methods in Ecology and Evolution},   year = {2018},   url = {https://doi.org/10.1111/2041-210X.13032}, }

title: Work with BEAST2 Packages
text: Work BEAST2 packages R. Related packages: babette full BEAST2 workflow. beautier creates BEAST2 input (.xml) files. beastier runs BEAST2 lumier helps create babette function call needed tracerer parses BEAST2 output (.log, .trees, etc) files. Non-CRAN extensions: beastierinstall Install uninstall BEAST2 mauricerinstall Install uninstall BEAST2 packages

text: install BEAST2 NS package: introduction video: YouTube video mauricer

title: Get all BEAST2 package names — get_beast2_pkg_names
code: get_beast2_pkg_names(   beast2_folder = beastier::get_default_beast2_folder(),   has_internet = curl::has_internet(),   verbose = FALSE )

title: Get all BEAST2 package names — get_beast2_pkg_names
text: beast2_folder folder BEAST2 installed. Note folder BEAST2 executable installed: BEAST2 executable subfolder. Use get_default_beast2_folder   get default BEAST2 folder. Use get_default_beast2_bin_path   get full path default BEAST2 executable. Use get_default_beast2_jar_path   get full path default BEAST2 jar file. has_internet boolean indicate user access internet. default, value equals result curl::has_internet verbose set TRUE extra output, can used debugging

title: Get all BEAST2 package names — get_beast2_pkg_names
text: data frame columns name package name, example, codebdmm installed_version installed version, example, 2.6.2.     installed_version NA package installed latest_version version number latest version, example,     2.6.3 dependencies packages package depends , example     BEASTLabs, GEO_SPHERE. dependencies empty     dependencies description description package, example     Nested sampling model selection posterior inference

title: Install a BEAST2 package — install_beast2_pkg
code: install_beast2_pkg(   name,   beast2_folder = beastier::get_default_beast2_folder(),   verbose = FALSE,   has_internet = curl::has_internet() )

title: Install a BEAST2 package — install_beast2_pkg
text: name package's name beast2_folder folder BEAST2 installed. Note folder BEAST2 executable installed: BEAST2 executable subfolder. Use get_default_beast2_folder   get default BEAST2 folder. Use get_default_beast2_bin_path   get full path default BEAST2 executable. Use get_default_beast2_jar_path   get full path default BEAST2 jar file. verbose set TRUE extra output, can used debugging has_internet boolean indicate user access internet. default, value equals result curl::has_internet

mauricer: Install BEAST2 packages. — mauricer-package
text: 'BEAST2' (<http://www.beast2.org>) widely used Bayesian phylogenetic tool, uses DNA/RNA/protein data many model priors create posterior jointly estimated phylogenies parameters.

title: mauricer: Install BEAST2 packages. — mauricer-package
text: 'BEAST2' commonly accompanied 'BEAUti 2' (<http://www.beast2.org>), , among others, allows one install 'BEAST2' package. package allows install 'BEAST2' packages 'R'. * get_beast2_pkg_names: get names BEAST2 packages * install_beast2_pkg: install BEAST2 package * is_beast2_pkg_installed: determine BEAST2 package installed * uninstall_beast2_pkg: uninstall BEAST2 package

title: mauricer: Install BEAST2 packages. — mauricer-package
text: Richèl J.C. Bilderbeek

Use get_default_beast2_bin_path   get full path default BEAST2 executable. Use get_default_beast2_jar_path   get full path default BEAST2 jar file. verbose set TRUE extra output, can used debugging has_internet boolean indicate user access internet. default, value equals result curl::has_internet
